alert.note: Alert for Barry (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 04 at 6:27PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 AM CDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. Flooding along Flat Creek is expected this evening through the overnight hours. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Missouri, including the following county, Barry. * WHEN...Until 630 AM CDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 625 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Up to 2 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following low water crossings... Flat Creek at Highway Y, Flat Creek at Highway U, Flat Creek at Highway C and Rockhouse Creek at Farm Road 2145. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Jenkins. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.
